name: Karpov Reflexivity Questionnaire
interpretation: When interpreting the results, it is advisable to proceed from the differentiation of the results obtained into three main categories. The results of the technique, equal to or greater than 7walls, indicate a highly developed reflexivity.  Results in the range from 4 to 7 walls are indicators of the average level of reflexivity.  Indicators less than 4 walls indicate a low level of development of reflexivity

questions.question: After reading a good book, I always think about it for a long time afterwards; I want to discuss it with someone
When I am suddenly asked about something, I can answer the first thing that came to mind
Before picking up the phone to make a business call, I usually mentally plan the upcoming conversation
After making a mistake, I can't stop thinking about it for a long time afterwards
When I think about something or have a conversation with another person, I find it interesting to suddenly remember what started the chain of thoughts
When starting a difficult task, I try not to think about the upcoming difficulties
The main thing for me is to present the ultimate goal of my activity, and the details are of secondary importance
Sometimes I can't understand why someone is unhappy with me
I often put myself in the other person's shoes
It is important for me to understand in detail the progress of the upcoming work
It would be difficult for me to write a serious letter if I didn't make a plan in advance
I prefer to act rather than reflect on the reasons for my failures
I can easily make a decision about an expensive purchase
As a rule, having conceived something, I scroll through my plans in my head, clarifying the details, considering all the options
I'm worried about my future
I think that in many situations it is necessary to act quickly, guided by the first thought that came to mind
Sometimes I make rash decisions
After finishing a conversation, I sometimes continue to conduct it mentally, giving more and more new arguments in defense of my point of view
If there is a conflict, then when thinking about who is to blame for it, I first start with myself
Before making a decision, I always try to think and weigh everything carefully
I have conflicts from the fact that I sometimes can't predict what behavior others expect from me
It happens that when I think about a conversation with another person, I sort of mentally conduct a dialogue with them
I try not to think about what thoughts and feelings my words and actions evoke in other people
Before making a remark to another person, I will definitely think about what words are best to do it so as not to offend them
When solving a difficult task, I think about it even when I'm doing other things
If I quarrel with someone, then in most cases I don't consider myself guilty
It rarely happens that I regret what I said
